title: PHPchunk_split()Function

metadata.description: Learn about PHPchunk_split()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
Split the string after each character and add a "." after each split:
<?php
$str = "Hello world!";
echo chunk_split($str,1,".");
?>

Definition and Usage
The chunk_split() function splits a string into a series of smaller parts.
Note:
This function does not alter the original string.
Syntax
chunk_split(
string,length,end
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
string
Required. Specifies the string to split
length
Optional. A number that defines the length of the chunks. Default is 76
end
Optional. A string that defines what to place at the end of each chunk. Default is \r\n
Technical Details
Return Value:
Returns the split string
PHP Version:
4+
More Examples
Example
Split the string after each sixth character and add a "..." after each split:
<?php
$str = "Hello world!";
echo chunk_split($str,6,"...");
?>

★
+1
